alert.note: Alert for Cherokee (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 17 at 9:02PM EST by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Cherokee, southeastern Polk and southeastern Monroe Counties through 945 PM EST... At 902 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles southeast of Etowah to 12 miles south of Benton. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Murphy, Ducktown, William L. Davenport Refuge, Coker Creek, Violet, Big Frog Mountain, Hot House, Turtletown, Copperhill and Hiawasse Dam. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
